intro: Semiaquilegia danxiashanensis, commonly known as the Danxiashan poppy, is a rare and endemic plant species native to China. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions with temperate climates. Its botanical features include lobed leaves and a tall, erect stem with clustered flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
